name: Relai

faqs.q: How do Relai's bitcoin buying fees work?
faqs.a: Relai charges a 1% service fee on each buy, drops to 0.9% when you enter an invite code, applies a dynamic spread of up to 1%, and waives the fee on your first auto-invest plan up to 100 CHF/€ per month.

faqs.q: Does Relai let me buy bitcoin straight to my hardware wallet?
faqs.a: Yes. Open Settings > Wallets in the Relai web app, connect your BitBox, Ledger, or Trezor, and sign the verification message so future buys settle to that address.

faqs.q: What is the minimum order size on Relai?
faqs.a: Relai orders start at 50 CHF or €50 whether you buy once or set up an auto-invest plan.

faqs.q: What payment methods does Relai support for buying bitcoin?
faqs.a: You can fund purchases with a manual SEPA transfer or use credit and debit cards, Apple Pay, or Google Pay for instant settlement, though cards add about 3% per order.
Relai focuses on Switzerland and the broader EEA, so confirm availability in your local app store and review which payment options are enabled in your country.

description:
Relai, founded in 2020 in Zürich, Switzerland, is an app designed for beginners to buy and save Bitcoin easily. It stands out from competitors with its non-custodial wallet, meaning users control their Bitcoin via a 12-word seed phrase. After purchasing Bitcoin, it will be directly sent to your wallet.

Relai offers purchases starting at €50 | 54,205 sats, one free buy up to €100 | 108,409 sats monthly, until you hit €1200. After that you pay a 1% fee for any transaction. For businesses and wealthy individuals Relai offers personal service and expert guidance.

Its app, rated 4.5 stars on iOS, is praised by users for simple onboarding and smooth navigation, though some users report verification delays or high card fees. Relai focuses on privacy and self-custody, with optional KYC for small transactions.

Its vision is to make Bitcoin saving accessible across Europe, with plans to add Lightning Network support for faster payments. Beginners love its straightforward design and security, but it's limited to Europe and lacks advanced savings features.

tl_dr.best_for: European savers who want bitcoin delivered straight into a self-custodial app with minimal steps.
tl_dr.consider_if: You plan to pair a hardware wallet with recurring buys and prefer SEPA funding over keeping cash on an exchange.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need Lightning withdrawals, desktop trading tools, or live outside Relai's supported countries.

steps.title: 1. Create & verify
actions: Install Relai from the App Store or Google Play and create your wallet.
Write your 12-word recovery phrase on paper, confirm it in-app, and store it safely offline.
Complete the ID verification Relai requests so you can fund larger orders without delay.
steps.gotcha: Never take a photo of the recovery phrase or store it in email.

steps.title: 2. Fund (SEPA / card)
actions: Tap the + button, choose Buy, then add your SEPA bank account or a card for instant funding.
If you pick SEPA, copy the Relai IBAN exactly and initiate the transfer from the same-name bank account.
For cards, complete the 3-D Secure approval and confirm you accept the ~3% processor fee.
steps.gotcha: SEPA transfers must match the currency quoted in the order or your bank may reverse the payment.

steps.title: 3. Buy & withdraw
steps.why: Own bitcoin and move it to your wallet.

chips.time: Instant with cards / ~10–30 min after SEPA posts

actions: Set a one-time amount or schedule an auto-invest plan and review the fee summary.
Leave delivery on the in-app wallet or toggle external wallet to paste a hardware wallet address.
Confirm the order; Relai covers the mining fee and broadcasts the transaction once the payment clears.
steps.gotcha: Auto-invest stays free only on your first active plan up to 100 CHF/€ each month.

micro_faqs.q: How do I connect a hardware wallet to Relai?
micro_faqs.a: Open the Relai web app, go to Settings > Wallets, choose Add new wallet address, select your hardware wallet, and sign the message on the device.

micro_faqs.q: How long do SEPA transfers take to fund a Relai order?
micro_faqs.a: Most SEPA transfers arrive within one to two business days; Relai executes the order and broadcasts the bitcoin once funds land.

micro_faqs.q: Can I edit or pause a Relai auto-invest plan?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. Open Orders, tap your plan, and you can change the amount, pause the schedule, or cancel it entirely.

fees_scenarios.title: Deposit cash
fees_scenarios.cost_today:
SEPA bank transfer: Free (Relai)
Credit/debit card, Apple Pay, Google Pay: ~3.0% processor fee
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Standard SEPA takes 1-2 days, but SEPA Instant transfers settle in minutes 24/7.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Use SEPA for larger orders, match the transfer currency to your quote, and avoid card funding unless you need the speed.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Only send funds from the bank account you registered in Relai so the transfer auto-matches to your pending order.

fees_scenarios.cost_today:

Invite code applied: 0.9%

fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Enter an invite code before you confirm, keep the free auto-invest plan within the monthly cap, and batch larger buys to reduce card fees.

fees_scenarios.title: Withdraw bitcoin
fees_scenarios.cost_today: Bitcoin network fee: Varies with mempool
fees_scenarios.what_happens: You send bitcoin from your Relai wallet on-chain to any external address, covering the mining fee yourself.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Wait for lower network fees and consolidate small UTXOs when the mempool clears.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Relai pays the mining fee on buys but you cover it on manual sends to hardware wallets or other addresses.

fees_faq.q: Does Relai cover the bitcoin network fee when I buy?
fees_faq.a: Yes. Relai pays the mining fee on purchases, so the sats you receive already include the on-chain cost.

fees_faq.q: How does the 0% auto-invest tier work on Relai?
fees_faq.a: Your first active auto-invest plan up to 100 CHF/€ per month runs at 0%; any extra volume or additional plans revert to the standard 1% fee.

fees_faq.q: How can I reduce Relai fees?
fees_faq.a: Add an invite code to drop buys to 0.9%, stick with SEPA transfers to avoid card fees, and schedule buys within the free auto-invest allowance.

compat_explainers.why: Relai keeps your bitcoin in the self-custodial wallet on your device, so buys land on-chain without waiting for withdrawal windows.
try: Open Relai, tap +, and choose Buy.
Enter the amount, confirm the funding method, and leave delivery on Relai wallet or switch to external wallet if needed.
Confirm the order; Relai covers the mining fee and broadcasts once funds clear.
Watch the transaction confirm in Relai or your hardware wallet.
compat_explainers.gotcha: SEPA orders broadcast only after the transfer arrives, and network congestion can still slow confirmation even though Relai covers the fee.

compat_explainers.why: Linking a hardware wallet lets you combine Relai's easy buys with cold storage security.
try: Open the Relai web app and go to Settings > Wallets.
Click Add new wallet address and select your hardware wallet brand.
Connect the device, follow the on-screen steps, and sign the verification message.
Name the address so future buys target the correct hardware wallet account.
compat_explainers.gotcha: Hardware wallet signing requires the Relai web app on a desktop browser; mobile browsers cannot pass the USB signature yet.

compat_explainers.why: Recurring buys help you stack sats consistently while keeping custody on your phone.

Review the schedule, confirm, and watch the plan appear under Orders.
Keep the amount within 100 CHF/€ per month to stay inside the 0% fee tier.
compat_explainers.gotcha: Only your first active plan up to 100 CHF/€ per month stays fee-free; extra volume reverts to the 1% service fee.

tiles.title: 1. Pick a cold storage wallet
tiles.why: Cold storage keeps long-term savings offline and away from phone risks.
actions: Choose a cold storage wallet that fits your budget and skill level.
Initialize the hardware wallet or cold storage software and generate a new seed phrase.
Record the seed on paper or metal and store backups in separate secure locations.
tiles.gotcha: Never store the new seed digitally or reuse the seed Relai generated for your mobile wallet.

tiles.title: 2. Create a fresh receive address
tiles.why: Fresh addresses protect privacy and make tracking easier.
actions: Connect your cold storage wallet to its desktop or mobile companion app.
Generate a new receive address and verify it on the hardware wallet screen.
Copy the address to Relai when you are ready to move larger balances.
tiles.gotcha: Use each address once; hardware wallets make it easy to generate a new one for every withdrawal.

tiles.title: 3. Send a small test amount
tiles.why: Testing the flow confirms your address and keeps stress low for bigger moves.
actions: Open Relai, tap Send, and paste the fresh address from your cold storage wallet.
Send a small amount (~€20) using the network fee Relai quotes.
Confirm the transaction in your hardware wallet app or on a block explorer.
tiles.gotcha: Wait for at least one confirmation before moving the rest.

tiles.title: 4. Withdraw the remaining balance
tiles.why: Finish the migration so your long-term sats live in cold storage.
actions: Generate another fresh address for the main withdrawal.
Send the remaining balance from Relai and record the transaction ID with your backups.
Export Relai transaction history so you can track cost basis later.
tiles.gotcha: Relai covers mining fees on buys but not on withdrawals, so wait for quieter mempool periods when possible.

micro_faqs.q: Can Relai recover my wallet if I lose the seed phrase?
micro_faqs.a: No. Relai never sees your 12-word seed, so the only recovery path is the backup you create.
Relai does not coordinate multisig today; pair the app with a hardware wallet or move large balances to a dedicated multisig provider.

micro_faqs.q: How often should I rotate receiving addresses in Relai?
micro_faqs.a: Relai issues a fresh address for every order; keep using new addresses to limit on-chain linking.

data_flows: Relai retains your name, address, and ID scans once you complete verification.
Card and mobile payments route through payment processors that can view your card details and approval history.
Support agents can access order history and delivery addresses to resolve funding or payout issues.
Your 12-word seed lives only on your device; Relai does not upload or store it on their servers.
privacy.data_flows_do: Lock the Relai app with a device passcode, review connected devices regularly, and revoke access you no longer use.
privacy.data_flows_dont: Share screenshots of your orders or seed phrase in chat apps or email threads.
recovery: Reinstall Relai on a new phone and choose Restore wallet when prompted.
Enter your 12-word seed carefully and keep the app open until balances resync.
Contact support only if you still see zero balance after the blockchain sync completes.
privacy.recovery_do: Store the seed offline, test a restore when convenient, and protect your email with its own two-factor authentication.
privacy.recovery_dont: Delete the app or wipe your phone before you confirm the restore worked.
withdrawal_policy: Buys broadcast on-chain once your SEPA transfer or card payment clears and Relai covers the mining fee.
Sells require you to send bitcoin back to Relai, so you pay the on-chain fee before they remit fiat.
SEPA payouts typically arrive within one to two business days depending on your bank.
privacy.withdrawal_policy_do: Plan sells during lower fee windows and keep a cushion of sats to cover the mining fee.
privacy.withdrawal_policy_dont: Assume card refunds or bank payouts settle instantly; track the transfer until it lands.
region: Relai holds a MiCA license (Oct 2025), guaranteeing service across all 30 EEA countries and Switzerland.
Apple Pay, Google Pay, and card processing depend on the country where your bank issued the card.
Tax reporting still varies by jurisdiction, so export your records and consult local guidance.

micro_faqs.q: Can Relai recover my seed phrase if I lose it?
micro_faqs.a: No. Relai never stores your 12-word seed, so only your offline backup can restore the wallet.
Not yet. All withdrawals and deliveries run on-chain today.

micro_faqs.q: How can I request my data or close my account?
micro_faqs.a: Use the in-app support chat or email support@relai.app to request data export or account deletion as outlined in their privacy policy.

migration.title: Restore Relai on a new phone
migration.choose: When you upgrade phones and want to keep using your existing Relai wallet.
steps: Install Relai on the new phone from the App Store or Google Play.
Tap Restore wallet, enter your 12-word seed, and keep the app open until balances resync.
Once the new device shows the correct balance, delete Relai from the old phone.
migration.tips: Verify the new install receives a small test transaction before you wipe the old device.
migration.gotcha: Running the same seed on two phones at once can cause conflicting states, so switch devices only after the restore finishes.

migration.title: Another wallet → Relai
migration.choose: When you want Relai to handle future buys but start with bitcoin stored elsewhere.
steps: Open your existing wallet and create a small on-chain send to the address Relai generates.
Wait for one confirmation to make sure the transfer arrived.
Once confirmed, schedule your Relai buys as usual and keep the seed backed up for both wallets.
migration.tips: Start with a small amount so you can verify the address flow before moving more bitcoin.
migration.gotcha: Relai cannot import another wallet's seed; you must send funds on-chain to consolidate.

migration.title: Relai → Long-term storage
migration.choose: When you want to migrate savings from Relai's in-app wallet to dedicated cold storage.
steps: Generate a fresh receive address on your hardware wallet or cold storage app.
In Relai, tap Send, paste the new address, and send a small test amount first.
After the test confirms, move the remainder in one or two larger transactions.
Record the transaction IDs and store them with your backup for future reference.
migration.tips: Plan withdrawals when network fees are low and keep a small balance in Relai for future DCA orders.
migration.gotcha: Relai pays the mining fee only on buys; you cover it when you send coins to external cold storage.
